The '''WWW Interactive Multipurpose Server (WIMS)''' (sometimes referred to as ''WWW Interactive Mathematics Server'') project is designed for supporting intensive mathematics exercises via the [[Internet]] or in a computer-equipped classroom with server-side interactivity, accessible at the address http://wims.unice.fr.
The system has the following main features: *A modular design allowing applications and software interfaces to be created and maintained independently from each other. *Features interfaces for software including MuPAD, PARI/GP, [[Gnuplot]], [[Povray]], Co. *Dynamic rendering of mathematical formulas and animated graphics. *A structure of virtual classes, including mechanisms for automatic score gathering and processing. <ref>[http://wims.unice.fr/paper/wims/wims.html WIMS Paper]</ref>
The program is open source and freely available under the [[GNU General Public Licence]], however each WIMS module has its own copyright policy, which may differ from that of the server program.<ref name="copyr"/>
It is often cited and linked<ref>[http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Special%3ASearch&search=wims.unice.fr List of Wikipedia articles linking to WIMS modules/applets]</ref> for its sophisticated "online calculator" tools capable of generating animated [[GIF]]s of parametric 2D or 3D graphs or allowing prime tests with very large numbers.
== Author == Xiao Gang works at the [[University of Nice Sophia Antipolis]]. He is interested in solar energy and algebraic geometry. He is also the active site manager of the WIMS of the university he works for.<ref>[http://wims.unice.fr/xiao/xiao.html Homepage of Xiao Gang at wims.unice.fr]</ref>
